title: GET RID OF ELO
body:
So i have only just started to play ranked this season and i have found that im not getting any as (I think my elo is BAD or something) im get game after game where on or more players on my team are trolling or just giving up or even bad in general (not my main concern you have to start some were) but as i loose these games it makes me look like a bad player for the looses and reporting such behavior feels like it goes unnoticed so whats the point.

So believe that this elo should be gone and it just COMPLETELY random with in your league or devison.

replies.body:
Just looking at your match history, in your last 5 ranked matches your direct lane opponent went:

13/7/4
10/2/11
18/6/4
17/0/2
10/2/0

In those games you also had an average cs/min of 4.3

I'm not saying these losses are your fault, but I'm thinking you might want to review your own performance before just blaming your team.
Yes every one wants to vs masters and challengers while in bronze.

I mean personally i would, you can only learn how to beat a master player by actually playing against one.

Play against one enough and youd eventually pick up a thing or two.
you dont learn anything when all you do it lose lane and flame over and over though.

> [{quoted}](name=sheep4ever,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=coEtRJwI,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-05-13T03:43:15.369+0000)
>
> So believe that this elo should be gone and it just COMPLETELY random with in your league or division.

Elo is gone. It is MMR now.
The issue is that Riot keeps the MMR system under lock and key.

This in itself causes issues. Let's say I said to you { For a point of reference } I will give you $1000 every time you did something for me. But then never told you what you had to do for it.
You would give up and just not worry about it??

WRONG.

You will ask over and over.. Keep trying to work out what it is and so on.
But then again I could just be telling you a lie for the sake of trying to make you think that elo is gone when it isn't.

See the issue really isnt that elo is or isn't gone. The issue is with the MMR system itself.
Most of the time you are in matches that are one sided. 

Like last night. I had a game that went for 40+ mins and it was great. WE WERE EVEN.
But the 10 games before that was one sided. Either I owned them or they owned me. The fact people are even talking about the MMR or elo points to the fact that there is a big issue with MMR.

But when you point this out everyone jumps on the wagon of " GET GOOD " or " YOU SUCK. "

Case in point

 
> [{quoted}](name=Arkangyle,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=coEtRJwI,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-05-13T14:50:13.859+0000)
>
> Just looking at your match history, in your last 5 ranked matches your direct lane opponent went:
> 
> 13/7/4
> 10/2/11
> 18/6/4
> 17/0/2
> 10/2/0
> 
> In those games you also had an average cs/min of 4.3
> 
> I'm not saying these losses are your fault, but I'm thinking you might want to review your own performance before just blaming your team.


This is a moronic mindset to have because from the start you have taken the idea you are better then them. 
Instead of the mind set.. We see 100+ post of this every week. 

mm MAYBE there is a issue. Might be time for some rethinking. 
When you think about what is really going on and the matches you have.. They shouldn't be one sided. They should be fun and hard to win. 
You shouldn't have one player that is just melting everyone.

The thing about elo is it was designed to rank a player for there win loss rate in chess

The thing about league is there are 5 players and no individual scoring system so your always going to be held back by the short comings of your team mates and be penalised for it.

Its a shitty system for a team game

It's not impossible to climb the ranks with the increasing numbers of toxic players or bad players in general. If you're determined enough to find a group of friends who are decent at the game you can improve your rank significantly. 
Also, perhaps the best solution is to work on your own game. You will be able to improve your ranking much faster if you play skillfully well above your current rank. Thats when you can jump entire tiers. 
Don't give up buddy, just keep practicing and you'll be happier with the results.
